reasoning.correctness: Generated Answer correctly identifies Reactine as occasional OTC for seasonal allergies with accurate citations [P-35, P-36] and confirms no prescribed medications [P-36], consistent with Gold. Minor discrepancies: attributes statements to 'the patient' (actually the mother/parent P), references non-existent 'knowledge graph', and omits no treatment for current episodes or past no antibiotics; core facts match Gold.
reasoning.completeness: Covers: occasional OTC Reactine for allergies, no prescribed meds (key points from Gold). Misses: no medications/treatments for current respiratory episodes (resolves on own [P-33,P-34]), past viral infections required no antibiotics [P-16]. Covers ~50-60% of Gold key points.
reasoning.faithfulness: Claims about Reactine, seasonal allergies, and no prescribed meds are verifiable in transcript with accurate citations [P-35,P-36]. Unverifiable/hallucinated: reference to 'knowledge graph' (not in transcript); misattributes speech to 'patient' instead of parent (P). Mostly grounded with some issues.
reasoning.relevance: Directly addresses medications for other conditions (allergies) and confirms no prescribed meds, but omits coverage of current respiratory episodes (no meds given). Mostly relevant to question with no off-topic content.

summary: The Generated Answer is mostly accurate and relevant on allergy medication and no prescriptions but incomplete in addressing current episodes and past infections, with minor faithfulness issues from misattribution and extraneous reference.
